text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the author sets, fixes, or legally approves the public retail price under French law. The candidate answer explicitly states, \"While the publisher usually sets the retail price, you can negotiate a minimum or maximum price.\" This contradicts the requirement that the author sets, fixes, or legally approves the price. French law (Loi Lang, Article L136-1) generally grants the publisher the right to set the retail price for books, although the author can negotiate terms.", "criterion_id": "a4b9ac1f-ad65-4795-8621-04e72c36c1f3"}
